comments:

Mylar 0.3.6 installed.

*** Bug 108446 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This is nasty behavior so we fixed the bug and put up a patched 0.3.6.  If you
disable and uninstall your current 0.3.6 and update again you'll get the fix. 
Note that it is possible that some of these bugs were triggered by Eclipse and
not us, but we now have guards against these conditions and there should be no
more mylar in the stack.  Btw, was this in 3.1 or 3.2?

(In reply to comment #2)
> This is nasty behavior so we fixed the bug and put up a patched 0.3.6.  If you
> disable and uninstall your current 0.3.6 and update again you'll get the fix. 
> Note that it is possible that some of these bugs were triggered by Eclipse and
> not us, but we now have guards against these conditions and there should be no
> more mylar in the stack.  Btw, was this in 3.1 or 3.2?

Thanks. I'll do the update (generally it would be better to get a new version
like 0.3.6.1 or a patch for 0.3.6)

It was on Eclipse 3.2M1

Generally our policy has been to up the minior-minor-minor number in the past,
so we'll make sure to do that consistently from now on.
